metadata.synopsis: After the goblins' raid on Halsin's camp, the tiefling leader berates the adventurers for causing trouble. The situation can escalate until one leader is knocked out, or it can be descalated with the aid of the player.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - ReCon: loadlevel WLD_Main_A- ReCon: goto 206.37, 30.50, 469.96- Wait until Aradin and his party run inside.- The dialogue should trigger automatically.

62.speaker: Zevlor
62.text: There are children here, you fool!
62.context: CinematicNodeContext:  NodeContext: Absolutely furious.  He and his crew nearly died. Right in Zevlor's face.

116.speaker: Aradin
116.text: We was running for our lives.
116.context: NodeContext: Exasperated. Thinks Zevlor is just being unreasonable.

39.speaker: Zevlor
39.text: You led them straight to us. And you let them take the druid, too. Unbelievable!
39.context: NodeContext: He's completely lost his temper at this point. Words are spat out.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Where there's one goblin, there's ten. I'm leaving before the horde shows up.

15.speaker: Aradin
15.text: They're right. We should scram while we can.

44.speaker: Zevlor
44.text: Right. Lead goblins here, then leave the rest of us to fight them off. You coward.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rolls his eyes in exasperation at the player and then points at Aradin.NodeContext: Disgusted with Aradin. Oozing with derision.

84.speaker: Aradin
84.text: What's it gonna take to shut you up, horns?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: One fight just ended, and now you're picking another? Relax.

134.speaker: Zevlor
134.text: Tell that to the dead at the gate.

46.speaker: Aradin
46.text: Shut it, horns. I'd be lying dead next to the goblins if you'd stalled any longer.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Points at Zevlor on first phrase - violent gesture. Emphasis on 'I'd' since he's responding to Zevlor talking of the deadNodeContext: Trying to turn the tide. Accusation is strong in his voice,

114.speaker: Zevlor
114.text: My duty is to this camp.

27.speaker: Aradin
27.text: God forbid you risk your precious tail. But I shouldn't be surprised.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Want me to knock you both out? Or would you prefer to skip the broken bones and just calm down?

98.speaker: Player
98.text: If you want me to take both of you down, I will. Otherwise, knock it off.

103.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tiefling lands a glancing blow across the man's temple.

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *With a thunk, the armoured man collapses - unconscious.*
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aradin falls to the ground

61.speaker: Zevlor
61.text: The goblins have found us. No doubt, the beasts will be back.

149.speaker: Zevlor
149.text: We need to pack up and leave. Immediately.
149.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns and prepares to leave.

74.context: CinematicNodeContext: In one swift move, the armoured man's fist makes contact with a sickening crunch.

60.speaker: Aradin
60.text: Shoulda done that a long time ago. Arrogant prick had it out for me from day one.

65.speaker: Aradin
65.text: No one leaves my people out cold.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You put him in a bind, showing up like that. And he did try to open the gate.

108.speaker: Aradin
108.text: He was right, though. Coming back to this hellhole was a mistake no amount of gold can put right.

47.speaker: Aradin
47.text: I'd rather face another round of goblins than stay in this pit.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: So you knocked him out cold instead. Clever.

73.speaker: Aradin
73.text: Only way he'd shut that hole under his nose.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: More violence won't bring back those you lost. Stop and think.

75.speaker: Zevlor
75.text: You're right. There's too much at stake.

88.speaker: Aradin
88.text: Worried about your precious hides, the both of you.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyebrow raised. Imperious. NodeContext: Seething with arrogance and a superiority complex.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: He's human - malice comes as naturally as breathing. Just show him you're the better man.

21.speaker: Zevlor
21.text: Forgive me, cousin. I... forgot myself.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks from his hands to you. NodeContext: Speaking to a fellow tiefling. Ashamed at what he's done and that he's let you down.

97.speaker: Zevlor
97.text: We have people to protect. Let us work towards that.
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to Aradin. NodeContext: Anger has mainly disappeared. Disgusted with himself but trying to lead. Still arrogant.

119.speaker: Narrator
119.text: *You see the tiefling's jaw clench. He's about to erupt.*
119.context: NodeContext: High tension. About to rear back and punch Aradin

13.speaker: Player
13.text: STOP OR I'LL BASH YOUR SKULLS TOGETHER MYSELF.

35.speaker: Zevlor
35.text: Enough. Squabbling is pointless. The goblins have found us.

10.speaker: Aradin
10.text: At least we agree on that.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Take a swing at the tiefling.

23.context: CinematicNodeContext: player punches Zevlor on the jaw, knocking him down

63.speaker: Aradin
63.text: Damn. You knocked him clean out.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I prefer to settle matters with my own hands.

107.speaker: Aradin
107.text: Aradin Beno. Leader of the Beno Boys. Adventurers for hire 'n all.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: You're not locals, then. Who runs this place?

165.speaker: Player
165.text: Got a healer in your crew?

115.speaker: Player
115.text: What would be nice is a healer. Do me a favour and point me to one.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I didn't do it for your praise. Just tell me what this place is.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Ah, 'devilkin'. Certainly never heard that one before. Creative.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: I'm sure you think so. Now point me to a healer.

110.speaker: Aradin
110.text: You're outta luck. Halsin - druid who runs this place - knew his stuff. But he ain't here anymore.

87.speaker: Aradin
87.text: Got himself nabbed by gobbos - same ones what chased us here.

53.speaker: Aradin
53.text: He's either diggin' latrines or boilin' in a cookpot by now.

113.speaker: Aradin
113.text: Think he's got an apprentice running around somewheres, though. Nadine? Natalie? Something like that.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: What was important enough to drag a druid out of his grove?

52.speaker: Aradin
52.text: We've got a contract to track down some relic, and he wanted in on the job. Eyes lit up when he heard about it.

34.speaker: Aradin
34.text: I told him he wasn't getting so much as a sniff of the reward, but he tagged along anyhow.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Maybe I could take that job off your hands, if you've lost your appetite for it.

1.speaker: Aradin
1.text: Got a death wish, have you? Contract came from a wizard in Baldur's Gate.

164.speaker: Aradin
164.text: Relic's supposedly hidden underneath a temple 'round these parts, and he'll pay gobloads for it.

159.speaker: Aradin
159.text: But all that gold ain't gonna do you any good if you're too cold to spend it.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Spare me the chilling warnings and just tell me where I can find this thing.

162.speaker: Aradin
162.text: If I knew that, I wouldn't be back here with half my crew gone.

157.speaker: Aradin
157.text: But look, if you're itching to meet Kelemvor, I won't stop you.

121.speaker: Aradin
121.text: It's called the Nightsong. Supposed to be hidden under the temple where the goblins jumped us.

40.speaker: Aradin
40.text: I'd give you the map and wish you a happy funeral, but my mate Brian kept hold of it like his own todger. Goblins made short of the fat old chunk.

155.speaker: Aradin
155.text: All I've got's the contract. It'll show you where we turned back, if you feel like dying.
155.context: InternalNodeContext: Needs a mapmarker for goblins

14.speaker: Aradin
14.text: Heh, don't thank me. I'll be well on my way to Baldur's Gate when you die.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: And you left him where, exactly?

152.speaker: Aradin
152.text: Gobbos are holed up in the temple ruins out west of here - last I saw Halsin, he was right in the thick of 'em.

135.speaker: Aradin
135.text: If you head that way, you'll likely smell 'em or hear their drums before you see 'em.

6.speaker: Aradin
6.text: Head back to Baldur's Gate. Better empty-handed than dead. I'm done with this shite.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Somewhere in my noxious blood, Baldur's Gate is calling to me.

16.speaker: Aradin
16.text: Tough hitter like you might last there. Maybe.

167.speaker: Aradin
167.text: Look me up if you're ever in the city. I owe you a pint.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: There are cut-throats there who'll leave you empty-handed and dead, just so you know.

148.speaker: Aradin
148.text: True enough. City's got pubs, though, don't it?

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Haven't seen any signs of a city in these parts. How far is it?

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Baldur's Gate is legendary. I've never clapped eyes on it, personally.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Best of luck. Hope your next contract's more fruitful.

68.speaker: Aradin
68.text: Keep that luck, mate. You'll need it.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Home sweet home. How far down the Chionthar are we?

120.speaker: Aradin
120.text: Far enough that I ain't sure we'll make it back in one piece. And before you ask, I ain't takin' tag-alongs.

4.speaker: Aradin
4.text: Tell you what, though: look me up if you're ever in the city. I owe you a pint.

72.speaker: Aradin
72.text: Ain't stayin' around here with this'n knocked cold out. Here's hopin' they'll grant mercy to one of their own.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: The Gate will take you for all you're worth with a smile. At least goblins rob you proper.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Before you go, let me see that contract. Maybe I'll fare better than you did.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: No points for effort. Care to tell me what this place is?

92.speaker: Aradin
92.text: It's a druids' grove - fella in charge went by the name Halsin. He ain't here anymore, though.

82.speaker: Narrator
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player starts to react, but is cut off

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Aim a blow at the human, trying to knock him flat on his back.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Druid? Those goblins didn't take any prisoners.

127.speaker: Aradin
127.text: We lost him back at the ruins - whole place is crawling with gobbos.

19.speaker: Aradin
19.text: Nobody forced him to go with us - he insisted. And when things got tough, he couldn't keep up. Simple as that.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: You can cough up my payment any time now.

146.speaker: Aradin
146.text: Stuff your payment. I didn't ask for any goddamn help.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Ah, backstabbing. This feels just like home.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Stop squealing like hatchlings or settle this matter in blood.

58.speaker: Aradin
58.text: What chewed you up and spit you out?

101.speaker: Zevlor
101.text: Show some respect! If not for them, your pathetic life would be over.

136.speaker: Aradin
136.text: Well, I didn't ask for any goddamn help.

12.speaker: Zevlor
12.text: Please. You were begging me to open the gate. Anything to save yourself, you coward.

145.speaker: Narrator
145.text: *The human's eye twitches. He's about to blow.*
145.context: NodeContext: High tension moment. Violence is about to erupt.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Aim a blow at the human.

104.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player punches Aradin, Aradin gets knocked out

137.speaker: Zevlor
137.context: NodeContext: He's happy but it's outside his zone of comfort (being a teacher)

81.speaker: Player
81.text: How about we cool those hot tempers and talk this through calmly?

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I've seen much bloodier battles than this. Consider yourselves lucky.

69.speaker: Aradin
69.text: And who the hell are you again?!

170.speaker: Player
170.text: What's unbelievable is how we beat the goblins! You're both heroes.
